Package graph

graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AllMWCFinder
    The class computes all maximal weighted cliques in a Graph.
    AllMWCFinderBK
    class provides an implementation of the Bron-Kerbosch algorithm for computing all maximal cliques in a graph (with pivoting).
    AllMWCFinderBKMT
    class provides a parallel implementation of the Bron-Kerbosch algorithm for computing all maximal cliques in a graph (with pivoting).
    AllMWCFinderBKMT0
    class provides a parallel implementation of the Bron-Kerbosch algorithm for computing all maximal cliques in a graph (with pivoting).
    AllMWCFinderBKMT2
    class provides a parallel implementation of the Bron-Kerbosch algorithm for computing all maximal cliques in a graph (with pivoting).
    DescendantNodesLabelUpdateTask
    helper auxiliary class for DSPPFinderFwdSrch is not part of the public API.
    DisjointSet
    Union-Find Set Data Structure.
    DisjointSetElem
    auxiliary class not part of the public API.
    DSPPFinderFwdSrch
    A parallel/distributed version of the "Shortest Path Calculation by Forward- Search" algorithm described on page 308 in Bertsekas & Tsitsiklis, "Parallel and Distributed Computation: Numerical Methods", Prentice-Hall, 1989 (1st ed).
    EMST
    Minimum Spanning Tree.
    Graph
    Graph class represents (directed) graphs, and is thread-safe with the exception of the methods ending with "Unsynchronized" which for performance purposes are not.
    GraphCacheMgr
    Graph object (memory) manager.
    GraphEdgeSetRemovalExecCmd
    auxilary class (not part of the public API despite the class status) encapsulates request to modify an existing graph by removing a set of links from this graph.
    HGraph
    HGraph class represents hyper-graphs where each edge ("net" to be precise), connects two or more nodes together.
    HLink
    represents nets connecting multiple nodes in hyper-graphs.
    HLinkPair
    the analogue of the LinkPair class for hyper-graphs.
    HNode
    the analogue of the Node class for hyper-graphs.
    Link
    represents links between nodes in Graph objects.
    LinkPair
    The class represents weighted links and is used in the graph.coarsening package classes.
    LoadGraphCmd
    forces hard loading of the graph onto worker's memory (if not already present).
    MWCFinderBKMT0
    class provides a parallel implementation of the Bron-Kerbosch algorithm for computing all maximum cliques in a graph (with pivoting).
    Node
    represents nodes in Graph objects.
    TriadCensus
    This class implements the TriadCensus Algorithm for counting all cardinality 3 sub-graphs in large graphs in parallel.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    GraphException
    Class represents exceptions in graph-related methods in the graph package.

Package graph Description

graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.

Package specification

The graph package provides a reentrant (thread-safe) Graph class that represents directed (as well as undirected) graph objects, their nodes (Node class) and links (Link class) between them. It also provides an HGraph class representing hyper-graph objects, namely graphs whose edges may connect more than 2 nodes, and the related classes HNode and HLink. Several algorithms are implemented that operate on Graph or HGraph objects: 1. Dijkstra's Shortest Path algorithm 2. Bron-Kerbosch All Maximal Cliques finding algorithm (parallel implementation) 3. Kruskal's Minimal Spanning Tree algorithm Several other algorithms will be implemented in the next version of the library
  • hyperlink
